my relationship with parth -- mount abu
link:
okay I'm travelling to mount abu with parth. primarily my first trip
with him. feels weird. what is wired?

its 3 at night and i feel quite awake and active and alive. how did this
happen? i suspect because i was working. because i did some, albeit very
little imo, but still meaningful work. 

what's about working that makes me feel so alive?? the fucking fact of
agency. of taking actions. it's amazing man. too good. 

back to what feels weird? umm he's grown up. he has a girlfriend. it's
hard to connect. we are together, but we don't connect. it's rare these
days that i find a genuine connection. .

there is someone more with parth. I'm avoiding him in some ways. there
is a way in which I'm avoiding talking to him. why the fuck did you
planned the trip at the first place? only because he wanted it? i think
because a part of me thought it's a good idea. the fast brain in me
thought so. that's it's great to have him. it would be nice to go on a
trip and spend time. doing what? talking probably? he's constantly
trying to make an effort. but i don't. 

yes fuck man. there is something here. something that I've always
avoided with him. something which came out on the mushroom trip. what is
it!??

in some senses I've never been present with him. for him. when did the
transition from i want to love my brother, to fighting, to ignoring
him. 

anyways there is really something there, ie I've been avoiding him for
most of my life. and it's very weird. i don't understand. 

okay how about this. this trip. let me try. a genuine try to connect to
him. like i can do with aseem. like talk about meaningful stuff and see
how it goes?



>

3 body problem - part 1
link:
part 1: the silent spring

chapter 1

it's cultural revolution in china. we are thrown in a weird scene of ye
wenjie's dad and mom on stage. the academic are considered intellectual
revolutionary and are being punished on stage by their students. 

the academics go through 3 different stages of mental breakdown. stage
one is denial where they beak down and die. stage two is when they are
punished enough and they beak down and die. stage three is when they are
punished enough that they start believing their ideas (like general
relativity, quantum mechanics) is against the system and then they die. 

ye's dad is the hardest person to break, hence his students/punisher ie
the red guard enjoys punishing him the most. he's made to wear steel
door and steel had and is beaten with belt by high school girls because
he patiently explains to everyone that quantum physics is true etc etc. 

they bring his wife on stage to humiliate him, the wife being forced to
play along. eventually they beat him to death for saying science doesn't
proof or disprove that God exists. everyone whats to believe that god is
an agenda. 

what's interesting is how when one girl starts being him, others join as
well. because if they don't they fear of being seen as supporting the
revolutionary ideas of dad. 

the scene ends with young ye seeing his dad dead. 

chapter 2

two years later ye is part of a big disforetstation effort. she feels
the pain of tree being cut. touches the leftover tree as a wound which
the tree suffers. 

she meets bai, a repoter who shares her pain. they connect over the book
the silent spring. he's writing a letter to bejing officials about
deforestation being bad for china. she reads the letter and offers to
re-write it in clean handwriting. 

next day she thrown in front of the higer ups for being still a
revolutionary for writing a letter to bejing. bai was caught and framed
ye for it. 

she's thrown in a cold cell. an officer comes, ask her to sign papers
saying her dad was involved in conspiracy, she refuses. the officer in
offence throws a bucket of water on her and her blanket. 

she left dying with cold feeling ice has consumed her. 

chapter 3

she's on a helicopter escorted to the tower peak. an old student of her
dad asked her to bring her on board a highly secret miltary project. 

tower peak is a mountain military base with a huge antenna which is sus
since start. it's known to kill birds, change weather, distrupt
surrounding. when she reaches the top the antenna testing starts, she
sees a blue ray going in the sky, a flock of birds die and she skin
shivers. 

former student warns her that if she decides to go in, she'll not be be
able to leave. she says yes without skipping a beat.
